conclusion: Radius of each semicircle is 1 m.
The first semicircle (A → B) lies above the straight baseline, the second (B → C) below it.
End-points A, B and B, C are diametrically opposite on each semicircle, so AB = 2R = 2 m and BC = 2R = 2 m.
The straight-line distance from A to C is AC = AB + BC = 2 m + 2 m = 4 m (due east).
A and C are on the same horizontal line, so their vertical coordinates are identical; displacement is therefore 4 m due east.
Length of one semicircle = πR = π(1 m) = π m.
Two semicircles give a total path length s = 2π m ≈ 6.283 m.
Average speed v̄_speed = total distance / time = (2π m)/(5 s) ≈ 1.26 m s⁻¹.
Average velocity v̄ = Δr / Δt = (4 m)/(5 s) = 0.80 m s⁻¹ due east.
Average velocity = 0.80 m s⁻¹ due east.
